column2: NE DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: NE

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column6: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.
column8: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.

column2: 2. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column6: go the wrong way.

column2: 3. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Warning signs

column2: 4. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 5. Roads are most slippery:
column6: on hills.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 6. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column6: indicate you are in a no passing zone.
column8: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 7. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 8. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column6: defensive driving

column2: 9. This sign means:
column6: Stay on the main highway if possible
column10: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 10. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column6: open a window.
column8: get some rest or change drivers.

column2: 11. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: black and orange.

column2: 12. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.
column6: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.
column8: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column10: drive to the right side of the road and stop.

column2: 13. Children up to age __ are prohibited from riding in cargo areas.
14. This road sign means:
column6: Steep downgrade ahead

column2: 15. Funeral procession escort vehicles:
column4: are considered emergency vehicles when escorted by funeral enforcement officers.
column6: are considered emergency vehicles.

column2: 16. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 17. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column6: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column8: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column10: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.

column2: 18. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it has just begun to rain.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: If it's been raining several hours.

column2: 19. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 20. When driving in snow, you should:
column4: slowly increase your speed for better traction.
column6: make speed and directional changes more gradually.
column8: use your cruise control if possible.

column2: 21. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column6: how fit you are.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 22. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column6: take precedence over

column2: 23. Yellow traffic signs:
column6: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 24. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
